info.title: API Version 3
info.description:
This is the documentation for the public api *(version 3)* of 99minutos. [https://www.99minutos.com/.](https://www.99minutos.com/.EnvironmentAPI)

# First Steps

1.  Create an account in the sandbox website: [https://delivery-git-sandbox-99minutos.vercel.app/](https://delivery-git-sandbox-99minutos.vercel.app/)
2.  Go to Developers section
3.  On API Keys V3 section click on `Generar`
4.  After this the `client_id` and `client_secret` will be displayed
    

Use the credentials to generate access tokens as shown below in the endpoint `create access token`

Follow the same process in production.

## Environments

| **Environment** | **Website** | **API url** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Sandbox | [https://delivery-git-sandbox-99minutos.vercel.app/](https://delivery-git-sandbox-99minutos.vercel.app/) | [https://sandbox.99minutos.com](https://sandbox.99minutos.com) |
| Production | [https://envios.99minutos.com/developers](https://envios.99minutos.com/developers) | [https://delivery.99minutos.com](https://delivery.99minutos.com) |

`Each environment has an independent set of credentials`

post.description: Confirm change the value draft to False for the given order id

parameters.name: orderid
parameters.description: orderId of the order that will be confirmed

get.description:
Return a order given an encoded order id.
The order id must be MongoDB identifier

post.description:
Return a list of pdf guides for the given identifiers.

Allowed sizes

| Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| letter | Document size of 9 x 11 |
| zebra | Document size of 6 x 8 |
| small | Document size of 4 x 6 |

All sizes are inches
ZPL returns a list of ZPL based on the received identifiers.

post.description: Get the location id of a given address Through this endpoint you can exchange an address for a location id. The purpose of this exchange is that later, in a second request, you can include the location id as origin or destination to create an order. Using this flow you won't need to include any more information and you can always reuse the location id for that point.

post.description: Request an access token sending the client credentials.

get.description: Get the list of active orders.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

origin.address: Av. del Taller 451, Jardín Balbuena, Álvaro Obregón, 15900 Ciudad de México, CDMX, México

destination.address: Av 9 Pte 308, Centro histórico de Puebla, Puebla, Pue., México

options.notes: **Information to be printed on the label**

CreateOrderCoords-based.description: It is the option with the best precision to define an origin or destination. Latitude and longitude are taken to define the location

options.notes: **Information to be printed on the label**

CreateOrderLocationId-based.description: A LocationId is a uuid that identifies a single geographic point. The locationId is generated by this API (check out the Get Location id request in Locations folder). By using locationId, no further data needs to be passed. It is useful when you have the same point in several shipments since you can reuse the locationId.

origin.address: C. de Venustiano, Centro Histórico, Cuauhtémoc, 06000 Ciudad de México, CDMX, México

destination.address: Calz. del Peñón 139, Azteca, Venustiano Carranza, 15320 Ciudad de México, CDMX, México

options.notes: **Information to be printed on the label**

CreateOrderAddressString-based.description: In this option the client sends only the address. We will process the address to obtain the other data. However, if the address does not contain information necessary to locate it, the system will return a 400 error and the order will not be created, so you must handle the error. It is important to emphasize that in the two previous flows there is no possibility to reject an order for the location

CreateOrderWithDeliveryDateRange.summary: Create order with delivery date range
CreateOrderWithDeliveryDateRange.description: In the options field you can set a delivery date range. Start and end keys represent date on which the package can be delivered

get.description: Return a shipment given an trackingId or internalKey

patch.description:
Update the destination address of a shipment. The shipment must be in one of the following statuses:

DRAFT
CONFIRMED
UNSUCCESSFULLPICKUP
ONROADTOPICKUP
COLLECTED
STORED

destination.address: Cda. de Guaymas 8, Roma Nte., Cuauhtémoc, 06700 Ciudad de México, CDMX, Mexico

origin.address: Av. del Taller 452, Jardín Balbuena, Álvaro Obregón, 15900 Ciudad de México, CDMX, México

destination.address: Cda. de Guaymas 8, Roma Nte., Cuauhtémoc, 06700 Ciudad de México, CDMX, Mexico

options.notes: **Information to be printed on the label**

delete.description: Cancels an order by trackingId or internalKey.

parameters.name: by
parameters.description: specifies whether the order is to be searched by trackingId or internalKey

get.description:
Track a shipment by the given identifier. Get all information about the shipments with the related events and data. **Remember that if you are thinking of implementing a recurring pull system on this endpoint, you must limit requests to a maximum of 8 per second. However, we also offer a real-time webhook notification system so you get every change in the status of the shipments, which is more efficient than pulling. For more information go to the webhooks section**

| **STATUS CODE** | **STATUS NAME** | **DESCRIPTION** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1001 | DRAFT | It is the first status when the shipment is created `in draft mode`. It means that the shipment is not yet ready by the client and its flow will not start until it is confirmed. Note that the draft value is passed when creating the order and defaults to false. Therefore, this status is only passed through if the draft was previously set to true when creating the order. |
| 1002 | CONFIRMED | The shipment has been confirmed. It is the first status to trigger the logistics operation. It is the first default state when creating an order (false draft) or when confirming a shipment that was previously created as a draft. |
| 2002 | ON_ROAD_TO_PICKUP | The shipment is on its way to be picked up. So a driver is heading to the point of origin. *`Does not apply to p99`* |
| 2003 | COLLECTED | The shipment has been collected and is in the domain of an associated driver of 99minutos. |
| 2101 | UNSUCCESSFUL_PICKUP | The shipment could not be collected. Within the response object, the attempt attribute is added with the number of collection attempts. `See examples` |
| 3001 | STORED | The shipment is stored in a wharehouse for 99minutos. |
| 3004 | ON_LINEHAUL | The shipment is in transit between stations for 99minutos `Not all shipments go through this state.` |
| 4001 | ON_ROAD_TO_DELIVERY | The shipment has left the network of 99minutos stations to the final destination |
| 4002 | DELIVERED | The shipment has been successfully delivered to its recipient |
| 4101 | UNSUCCESSFUL_DELIVERY | The shipment could not be delivered. Inside the response object, the attempt attribute is added with the number of delivery attempts. `See examples` |
| 5001 | ON_ROAD_TO_RETURN | Shipping on the way to return. The return occurs when it is not possible to deliver the package to the recipient and it is returned to the origin |
| 5002 | RETURNED | The shipment has been returned to the origin successfully |
| 5101 | UNSUCCESSFUL_RETURN | The shipment could not be returned. Inside the response object, the attempt attribute is added with the number of return attempts. `See examples` |
| 7101 | IN_CORRECTION | In some cases the information of origin, destination, etc. may not be precise enough to make the shipment. Therefore, this status indicates that some information of the shipment must be corrected. |
| 7102 | CORRECTED | If the shipment required correction, it indicates that this has already been done. |
| 8001 | STOLEN | In extremely rare cases for reasons other than 99minutos the shipment is stolen. `This is extremely rare.` |
| 8003 | CANCELLED | The shipment has been canceled via API by the client |
| 8004 | DAMAGED | The shipment was damaged during delivery. |

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The identifier represent a internalKey or trackingId of one shipment.

TooManyRequests.description: if you are thinking of implementing a recurring pull system on this endpoint, you must limit requests to a maximum of 8 per second.

get.description:
Batch tracking can add multiple identifiers of the following format -->  `/api/v3/shipments/tracking/batch?identifiers={trackingId}&identifiers={trackingId}`

Track a shipment by the given identifier. Get all information about the shipments with the related events and data. **Remember that if you are thinking of implementing a recurring pull system on this endpoint, you must limit requests to a maximum of 8 per second. However, we also offer a real-time webhook notification system so you get every change in the status of the shipments, which is more efficient than pulling. For more information go to the webhooks section**

| **STATUS CODE** | **STATUS NAME** | **DESCRIPTION** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1001 | DRAFT | It is the first status when the shipment is created `in draft mode`. It means that the shipment is not yet ready by the client and its flow will not start until it is confirmed. Note that the draft value is passed when creating the order and defaults to false. Therefore, this status is only passed through if the draft was previously set to true when creating the order. |
| 1002 | CONFIRMED | The shipment has been confirmed. It is the first status to trigger the logistics operation. It is the first default state when creating an order (false draft) or when confirming a shipment that was previously created as a draft. |
| 2002 | ON_ROAD_TO_PICKUP | The shipment is on its way to be picked up. So a driver is heading to the point of origin. *`Does not apply to p99`* |
| 2003 | COLLECTED | The shipment has been collected and is in the domain of an associated driver of 99minutos. |
| 2101 | UNSUCCESSFUL_PICKUP | The shipment could not be collected. Within the response object, the attempt attribute is added with the number of collection attempts. `See examples` |
| 3001 | STORED | The shipment is stored in a wharehouse for 99minutos. |
| 3004 | ON_LINEHAUL | The shipment is in transit between stations for 99minutos `Not all shipments go through this state.` |
| 4001 | ON_ROAD_TO_DELIVERY | The shipment has left the network of 99minutos stations to the final destination |
| 4002 | DELIVERED | The shipment has been successfully delivered to its recipient |
| 4101 | UNSUCCESSFUL_DELIVERY | The shipment could not be delivered. Inside the response object, the attempt attribute is added with the number of delivery attempts. `See examples` |
| 5001 | ON_ROAD_TO_RETURN | Shipping on the way to return. The return occurs when it is not possible to deliver the package to the recipient and it is returned to the origin |
| 5002 | RETURNED | The shipment has been returned to the origin successfully |
| 5101 | UNSUCCESSFUL_RETURN | The shipment could not be returned. Inside the response object, the attempt attribute is added with the number of return attempts. `See examples` |
| 7101 | IN_CORRECTION | In some cases the information of origin, destination, etc. may not be precise enough to make the shipment. Therefore, this status indicates that some information of the shipment must be corrected. |
| 7102 | CORRECTED | If the shipment required correction, it indicates that this has already been done. |
| 8001 | STOLEN | In extremely rare cases for reasons other than 99minutos the shipment is stolen. `This is extremely rare.` |
| 8003 | CANCELLED | The shipment has been canceled via API by the client |
| 8004 | DAMAGED | The shipment was damaged during delivery. |

parameters.description: The identifier represent a internalKey or trackingId of one shipment.

PatchedShipmentUpdate.description:
Update shipment serializer.
Only the origin and destination fields can be updated.
The deliveryType is not in read only fields because
is required for the covered

destination.address: Cda. de Guaymas 8, Roma Nte., Cuauhtémoc, 06700 Ciudad de México, CDMX, Mexico

ShipmentUpdate.description:
Update shipment serializer.
Only the origin and destination fields can be updated.
The deliveryType is not in read only fields because
is required for the covered

internalKey.description: Unique shipment identifier. You can use this field to store your unique identifier of the shipment. All of our tracking systems support searching by internalKey. We strongly suggest you always use this field and make sure it is unique.If its not given we will assign an uuid for this field.

locationId.description: Unique uuid for the location. This id can be used to refer an origin or destination in the order creation endpoint.

Coverage.description: Check if your shipment has coverage.

origin.description: Shipping origin location. You can include the location_id or the coordinates of the location (latitude and longitude)

destination.description: Shipping destination location. You can include the location_id or the coordinates of the location (latitude and longitude)

deliveryType.description: Indicate the Delivery Type which can be SameDay(SMD), Sprint (SPT), 99minutos(99M), Co2Free (CO2F), Reverse(RET), PuntoaPunto (P2P). Be careful submitting accepted abbreviations.

CoverageByZipcode.description:
Check if your shipment has coverage by zipcode.
This feature at the moment is only available for Mexico

origin.description: Shipping origin location. You must include the zipcode

destination.description: Shipping destination location. You must include the zipcode

DeliveryType5c6Enum.description: Indicate the Delivery Type which can be SameDay(SMD), Sprint (SPT), 99minutos(99M), Co2Free (CO2F), Reverse(RET) Tailor made (TLM), PuntoaPunto (P2P). Be careful submitting accepted abbreviations.

Embedded.description:
Serializer for EmbeddedDocuments.

Skips id field and uniqueness validation.
When saving, skips calling instance.save

identifier.description: The identifier represent a internalKey or trackingId of one shipment.

size.description:
All sizes are inches
letter -> Document size of 9 x 11
zebra -> Document size of 6 x 8
small -> Document size of 4 x 6

length.description: Horizontal measurement in centimeters take from one end to the other of the longer or longest side of an object

width.description: Horizontal measurement in centimeters taken from one end to the other of theshorter or shortest side of an object

height.description: Vertical measure in centimeters of distance from base to top

Location.description:
Location where the package is picked up.
Depending on the flow you choose,
you must send different parameters.

A location is a geographical point that can be taken as the origin and/or destination of a shipment.

There are 3 ways in which you can define a location, feel free to choose the one that best suits your business rules.
Each one is described below.

1. Coords-based
It is the option with the best precision to define an origin or destination.
Latitude and longitude are taken to define the location

2. LocationId-based
A LocationId is a uuid that identifies a single geographic point.
The locationId is generated by this API (check out the Get Location id request in Locations folder).
By using locationId, no further data needs to be passed.
It is useful when you have the same point in several shipments since you can reuse the locationId.

3. Address string-based
In this option the client sends only the address. We will process the address to obtain the other data.

However, if the address does not contain information necessary to locate it,
the system will return a 400 error and the order will not be created, so you must handle the error.

It is important to emphasize that in the two previous flows there is no possibility to reject an order for the location

locationId.description: LocationId is a uuid that identifies a single geographic point.

address.description: Text sentence that references the location. This address will be printed on the labels.

reference.description: Any other text that enrich the address of the location such apartment, Suite, Box number, Tower, etc.

zipcode.description: Location zipcode. If it is not included we will try to extract the zipcode from the address. So if your address does not include zipcode, you must include it in this field

city.description: Text that reference the city of the location

locationId.description: Unique uuid for the location. This id can be used to refer an origin or destination in the order creation endpoint.

locationType.description: p99_network if the location belongs to our network of points 99 or private if is a private address outside of p99_network.

locationId.description: Unique uuid for the location. This id can be used to refer an origin or destination in the order creation endpoint.

includeP99.description: p99 represents the network of point99. If you set it to true, the nearests p99 place locations will be returned. Otherwise, only will be returned the location according to the giving address.

distance.description: Maximum distance in meters between the given direction and the nearest p99

items.example: Calle Zoquipa 196, El Parque, Venustiano Carranza, 15960 Ciudad de México, CDMX, México

pickUpAfter.description: Date time from which the shipment is available for pickup

twoFactorAuth.description: Code is required to mark the order as delivered. Needs to be activated previously

notes.description: Notes that will be displayed on the label

draft.description: Indicates if an order is not yet finalized. The order is only processed when is confirmed. By default it's false.

Payment.description: Payment options are included in this section

insuredValue.description: Amount in local currency for which the shipment will be insured. The shipment will be insured in case of damage, loss, theft. Extra fees could be applied, check with your support agent.

cashOnDelivery.description: Cash on delivery (COD) applies to shipments paid by the recipient in cash at the time of delivery. If it is not sent in the payload, it is assumed that this does not happen, otherwise the amount and currency fields must be included

deliveryType.description: DeliveryType of the shipments. Refers to allowed values in the shipment schema detailed above.

size.description: Size of the itme. Refers to allowed values in the item schema detailed above.

Recipient.description: Person who will receive the shipment.

firstName.description: Name of the person receiving or sending the shipment.

lastName.description: Last name of the person receiving or sending the shipment.

phone.description: Phone of the person receiving or sending the shipment. Must include the international code (+52, +51)

email.description: Email of the person receiving or sending the shipment.

Sender.description: Person who will receive the shipment.

firstName.description: Name of the person receiving or sending the shipment.

lastName.description: Last name of the person receiving or sending the shipment.

phone.description: Phone of the person receiving or sending the shipment. Must include the international code (+52, +51)

email.description: Email of the person receiving or sending the shipment.
